JobFullDesc:
Clarus Commerce is seeking an Analytics Lead who will report to the Senior Director of Marketing Analytics.  Serving in this position, the Analytics Manager will be a key player in generating and disseminating analytic information and insights critical to the success of the organization.  If you're a person who has interest in growing into an analytics powerhouse in a fun and fast-paced environment, then this position might be for you! Once the Company returns to the office in October, this person will have the opportunity to routinely work remotely for part of the week.  Responsibilities of the Analytics Manager:


Provide ongoing and ad-hoc analytics support for the Premium Loyalty side of the business, including: marketing, finance, operations, and client teams by pulling data, running reports, etc. 
Analyze and monitor front-end and back-end A/B testing initiatives 
Extract, validate, transform, and summarize data generated from database and reporting tools  
Assist with pulling and analyzing data for both internal and external quarterly business reviews (QBRs) 
Serve as Business Relationship customer partner in developing new reporting and enhancing business capabilities 
Serve as subject matter expert pertaining to design of experiment (DOE) 
 Ability to think out of the box to help move the business and the analytics team to mature capabilities and find new opportunities through data 
Work directly with Data Management Team on quality assurance, user acceptance testing, and data integrity initiatives 
Engage with multiple clients to understand their needs and use of analytic capabilities  

Desired Skills and Experience of the Analytics Manager:


Proficient in Microsoft Office, including Word, Excel, and Access 
Basic understanding of common marketing metrics, such as Click-thru Rate, Open Rate, Conversion, etc. 
Proficient understanding of Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau and others. 
Proficient math, problem-solving, and SQL skills 
Eager learner who can succeed in telling the story hidden within data with minimal supervision 
Detail-oriented and curious  
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present to small teams and individuals 
Ability to manage competing priorities and business demand 
4+ years of hands-on quantitative experience 
Ability to solicit and document business needs 
Experience or knowledge of Agile execution and scrum execution a plus but not required
